location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'ATTEMPT TO BLOW UP BRITISH TANKERS IN THE SUEZ CANAL'

physicalDescription.extent: The papers in this file are arranged chronologically from the front to the rear of the file. There are file notes on folio 5.

Foliation: the main foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover and terminates at the back cover; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio. An additional foliation sequence is also present in parallel between ff 1-5; these numbers are also written in pencil, but are not circled, and are located in the same position as the main sequence.

mods.abstract: Correspondence discusses the possibility of an attempt to blow up British tankers in the Suez Canal by means of bringing up a small boat alongside. The Senior Naval Officer Persian Gulf communicated this to the Political Resident in the Persian Gulf, the Political Agent, Bahrain, and R M Brown, Chief Local Representative, Bahrain Petroleum Company.

name.namePart: Bahrain Petroleum Company, Chief Local Representative
Senior Naval Officer in the Persian Gulf
